definition: more than one; many
to cause very strong feelings, especially anger or excitement, in a person or in a group of people
to make a situation worse or more difficult to deal with
a beauty treatment in which somebody's hair is dried with a hairdryer and shaped into a particular style
in a way that is based on reason rather than emotion
in a way that is not based on, or does not use, clear logical thought
saying or doing the same thing many times, so that it becomes boring
repeated many times
perfectly; in the most suitable way
in an imagined way; in a way that is not likely to happen or be real
a state of not being certain about what is happening, what you should do, what something means, etc.
the fact of making a mistake about who somebody is or what something is
a situation in which you feel embarrassed because you do not understand something and are not sure what to do
a confused situation in which people do not know what action to take
relating to psychiatry or to mental illnesses
the practice of sending emails that appear to come from somebody else's email address
the activity of copying a film, TV programme, etc. in a humorous way by exaggerating its main features
the scientific study of mental illness
an illness or condition that affects somebody’s mind or their behaviour
relating to one or more chromosomes
connected with the scientific study of the physical structure of the earth, including the origin and history of the rocks and soil of which the earth is made
connected with the origin and history of the rocks and soil of a particular area
relating to microorganisms (= extremely small living things), especially bacteria that cause disease or fermentation
the state of not being continuous
a break or change in a continuous process
more important, powerful or easy to notice than other things
a dominant gene causes a person to have a particular physical characteristic, for example brown eyes, even if only one of their parents has passed on this gene
an actor who learns the part of another actor in a play so that they can play that part if necessary
belonging to a very simple society with no industry, etc.
belonging to an early stage in the development of humans or animals
very simple and old-fashioned, especially when something is also not convenient and comfortable
very strong and not based on reason, as if from the earliest period of human life
a particular way of doing something; a particular type of something
the way in which a piece of equipment is set to perform a particular task
a particular way of feeling or behaving
a particular style or fashion in clothes, art, etc.
a set of notes in music that form a scale
the value that appears most frequently in a series of numbers
the particular way in which something exists, is experienced or is done
the idea expressed by modals
the kind of senses that the body uses to experience things
the situation when somebody has to leave their job because there is no more work available for them
the state of not being necessary or useful
showing signs of being good or successful
a light canoe in which the part where you sit is covered over
a plant or an animal that is produced naturally or artificially from the cells of another plant or animal and is therefore exactly the same as it
a person or thing that seems to be an exact copy of another
a computer that is a copy of another more expensive model
small and attractive
to imagine that you are doing something that you would like to do, or that something that you would like to happen is happening, even though this is very unlikely
to cut hair from the skin, especially the face, using a razor
to cut a small amount off a price, etc.
a wound that you get when a poisonous snake bites you
an alcoholic drink made of equal parts of beer and cider

a piece of writing in which the words are chosen for their sound and the images they suggest, not just for their obvious meanings. The words are arranged in separate lines, usually with a repeated rhythm, and often the lines rhyme at the end.
the white part of the eye
how food or drink tastes
a particular type of taste
a substance added to food or drink to give it a particular taste
a particular quality or atmosphere
an idea of what something is like
a particular type of something, especially computer software
a person or thing that is very popular at a particular time
a cake or other sweet food that looks very attractive
a thing such as a building or piece of clothing, that is made in a way that is complicated or shows skill
